title: Which most closely describes your racial group(s)?
Which most closely describes your ethnic group?
Which most closely describes your gender?
What was your biological sex at birth?
How old are you (in years)?
Where would you place yourself on the ladder?
Do you have – or have you had – a diagnosed, on-going mental health/illness/condition?
Do you have any diagnosed mental health condition that is uncontrolled (by medication or intervention) and which has a significant impact on your daily life / activities?
Do you experience depression?
Do you experience anxiety?
Do you consider yourself to have attention deficit disorder (ADD)/attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)?
Are you willing to download and run tasks on your computer?
Have you been diagnosed with a mood disorder
Which mood disorders have you been diagnosed with? Please select all that apply.
How many years ago were you first diagnosed with a mood disorder (to the best of your ability to recall)?
Are you currently receiving treatment for this disorder, if so, which types? Please select all treatments that you have received in the last month that are intended to treat your mood disorder(s).
In the past two weeks have you been bothered by symptoms of your mood disorder(s)?
Have you been diagnosed with an anxiety disorder
Which anxiety disorders have you been diagnosed with? Please select all that apply.
How many years ago were you first diagnosed with an anxiety disorder (to the best of your ability to recall)?
Are you currently receiving treatment for this disorder, if so, which types? Please select all treatments that you have received in the last month that are intended to treat your anxiety disorder(s).
answer: Serotonin and Norepinephrine Reuptake Inhibitor (SNRI), such as: Cymbalta (duloxetine), Effexor (venalfaxine)

title: In the past two weeks have you been bothered by symptoms of your anxiety disorder(s)?
Have you been diagnosed with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) or attention-deficit disorder (ADD)?
Which attention disorders have you been diagnosed with? Please select all that apply.
How many years ago were you first diagnosed with an attention disorder (to the best of your ability to recall)?
Are you currently receiving treatment for this disorder, if so, which types? Please select all treatments that you have received in the last month that are intended to treat your anxiety disorder(s).
In the past two weeks have you been bothered by symptoms of your attention disorder(s)?
Fail to give close attention to details or make careless mistakes in my work or other activities
Difficulty sustaining my attention in tasks or fun activities
Don't listen when spoken to directly
Don't follow through on instructions and fail to finish work or chores
Have difficulty organizing tasks and activities
Avoid, dislike, or am reluctant to engage in tasks that require sustained mental effort
To check if you are a true respondent, please select "Very often" for this item.
Lose things necessary for tasks or activities
Easily distracted by extraneous stimuli or irrelevant thoughts
Forgetful in daily activities
Fidget with hands or feet or squirm in seat
Leave my seat in classrooms or in other situations in which remaining seated is expected
Shift around excessively or feel restless or hemmed in
Have difficulty engaging in leisure activities quietly (feel uncomfortable, or am loud or noisy)
I am "on the go" or act as if "driven by a motor" (or I feel like I have to be busy or always doing something)
Talk excessively (in social situations)
Blurt out answers before questions have been completed, complete others' sentences, or jump the gun
Have difficulty awaiting my turn
Interrupt or intrude on others (butt into conversations or activities without permission or take over what others are doing)
Prone to daydreaming when I should be concentrating on something or working
Have trouble staying alert or awake in boring situations
Easily confused
Easily bored
Spacey or "in a fog"
Lethargic, more tired than others
Underactive or have less energy than others
Slow moving
I don't seem to process information as quickly or as accurately as others
Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Worrying too much about different things
Trouble relaxing
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Feeling down, depressed, irritable or hopeless
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Poor appetite or overeating
Feeling bad about yourself – or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as school work, reading or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite – being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
I had very little energy.
I worried that others would abandon me.
Thoughts were racing through my head.
It was easy for me to laugh.
I stuffed myself with food.
I was unable to enjoy things like I normally do.
I wanted other people to take care of me.
I had a lot of nervous energy.
I wanted someone else to make decisions for me.

I avoided performing or giving a talk in front of others.
I was overwhelmed by anxiety.
